measured_by: average frequency ratings of holistic combination-method items (1–5 scale)
justification: “Participants … reported how frequently (1 = never, 5 = always) they use several methods to combine information… We collapsed these methods into the two holistic and mechanical meta-categories by averaging participants’ frequency responses to combination method 1, 2, 3, 5, and 7.”

measured_by: average frequency ratings of mechanical combination-method items (1–5 scale)
justification: The same paragraph notes that responses to combination methods 4, 6, and 8 were averaged to create the mechanical meta-category, thus operationalising algorithm use.

measured_by: pre-listed checklist of reasons for not using an algorithm
justification: “Participants who reported not always using some form of mechanical prediction … selected pre-listed reasons why they do not always use an algorithm (see Table 2).”

measured_by: frequency ratings of consulted sources items (e.g., HR blogs, academic journals)
justification: “Moreover, all participants indicated how frequently they consult several sources (e.g., other professionals, academic or professional literature) to obtain information about how to best make hiring decisions (see Table 4).”
